modelCorrections.beforeModification: <div role="button" aria-selected="true" aria-label="Click to select the Dischem  tab." tabindex="0" class="CustomerSuccessstyled__ImageWrap-sc-1kt39ue-8 lkacQL">
modelCorrections.afterModification: <button aria-pressed="true" aria-label="Click to select the Dischem tab." tabindex="0" class="CustomerSuccessstyled__ImageWrap-sc-1kt39ue-8 lkacQL">
modelCorrections.rawOutput:
Here's the corrected HTML based on the WCAG 2.1 violation description:

- Incorrect HTML: <div role="button" aria-selected="true" aria-label="Click to select the Dischem  tab." tabindex="0" class="CustomerSuccessstyled__ImageWrap-sc-1kt39ue-8 lkacQL">
- Thought: The element has a role of "button", but it also has an ARIA state attribute (aria-selected="true") which is not valid for buttons. The correct ARIA state attribute for a button is "aria-pressed". Additionally, the element is a <div> and not a <button>, so it's best to use the appropriate semantic HTML element.
- Corrected HTML: <button aria-pressed="true" aria-label="Click to select the Dischem tab." tabindex="0" class="CustomerSuccessstyled__ImageWrap-sc-1kt39ue-8 lkacQL">

modelCorrections.beforeModification: <div role="button" aria-selected="false" aria-label="Click to select the Imperial tab." tabindex="0" class="CustomerSuccessstyled__ImageWrap-sc-1kt39ue-8 lkacQL">
modelCorrections.afterModification: <div role="button" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="Click to select the Imperial tab." tabindex="0" class="CustomerSuccessstyled__ImageWrap-sc-1kt39ue-8 lkacQL">
modelCorrections.rawOutput:
Here's the corrected HTML based on the WCAG 2.1 violation description:

- Incorrect HTML: <div role="button" aria-selected="false" aria-label="Click to select the Imperial tab." tabindex="0" class="CustomerSuccessstyled__ImageWrap-sc-1kt39ue-8 lkacQL">

- Thought: The element has a role of "button", but it also has an ARIA state attribute (aria-selected="false") which is not valid for buttons. The aria-selected attribute is typically used for elements with roles like "tab", "option", or "gridcell". Since the element is intended to function as a button, the appropriate ARIA attribute to indicate its state would be aria-pressed.

- Corrected HTML: <div role="button" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="Click to select the Imperial tab." tabindex="0" class="CustomerSuccessstyled__ImageWrap-sc-1kt39ue-8 lkacQL">

In the corrected HTML, I replaced the aria-selected attribute with the aria-pressed attribute, which is the appropriate ARIA state attribute for elements with a role of "button". This ensures that the element's state is correctly communicated to assistive technologies, improving accessibility and adhering to the WCAG 2.
